intro: Triphora giraldoi, commonly known as the Giraldo's triphora, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and botanical research.
